column5: Looks like american strike gonna affect canadian plants again   http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/reuters/canada_...ada_layoffs_col
Chrysler will probably welcome a strike. It would cut many millions from their payroll.
If I worked for Chrysler I'd wake up every day hoping to have a job to go to before they fold.
Maybe they should start building quality vehicles?...Toyota, Nissan, Honda are all thirsty for our business and it shows in their quality.

Actually Toyota & Honda's quality has been going down in recent years. They've been having a lot more recalls and more trips to the repair shop. A lot of the parts that go into Toyotas, Hondas, Fords Chrysler etc. are made by the same company.
looks like the strike is over  http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/capress/us_auto_talks
Glad to hear that!  My girlfriend works at a parts plant in Port Hope making dashboards for the plant in Brampton. Good to hear she won't be laid off anytime soon.
